title: Slayer task/Kalphites

properties.name: description
properties.value: Kalphites can be assigned as a slayer task at level 15 combat by all slayer masters, with the exception of Wilderness slayer master Krystilia. Kalphites come in a wide variety of levels, which is why they are possible tasks from all slayer masters. They are mainly found in the Kalphite Lair in the north-west of the Kharidian Desert. A Slayer task-exclusive area can be found in the Kalphite Cave just east of Shantay Pass.

Kalphites can be assigned as a slayer task at level 15 combat by all slayer masters, with the exception of Wilderness slayer master Krystilia. Kalphites come in a wide variety of levels, which is why they are possible tasks from all slayer masters. They are mainly found in the Kalphite Lair in the north-west of the Kharidian Desert. A Slayer task-exclusive area can be found in the Kalphite Cave just east of Shantay Pass.

Kalphites comes in four varieties: workers, soldiers and guardians, as well as the boss monster the Kalphite Queen. With the exception of the Queen, all Kalphites use melee attacks. Additionally the soldiers and guardians can induce poison starting at 4 and 6 hitpoints damage respectively.

They are weak to melee attacks, especially crush attacks. Many are found in multi-combat areas, which mean players can attack multiple kalphites at once. The dwarf multicannon can also be set up in these areas to increase number of kills. (Note: The cannon will be destroyed by the Kalphite Queen, if set up in her arena.) Because of their large size and use of melee attacks, they can easily be safespotted throughout the cave networks.

Keris[edit | edit source]

Keris is a dagger awarded from completing the Contact! quest. It increases damage against all kalphites by 33% with a 1/51 chance of dealing a hit with tripled damage. However, in general, Keris is not recommended because of its low accuracy. Its stab attack is identical to that of a dragon dagger, with a Strength bonus of 10 lower. This makes the Dragon scimitar or Abyssal whip more ideal for fast damage.

Monster Variants[edit | edit source]

Monster Combat level Slayer XP Locations Notes
Kalphite Worker 28 40
  • Kalphite Lair
  • Kalphite Cave
  • The weakest variant of Kalphite.
Kalphite Soldier 85 90
  • Kalphite Lair
  • Kalphite Cave
  • A mid-level variant of Kalphite. Can induce poison beginning at 4.
Kalphite Guardian 141 170
  • Kalphite Lair
  • Kalphite Cave
  • A high-level variant of Kalphite. Can induce poison beginning at 6.
Kalphite Queen 333 535.5
  • Kalphite Lair
  • Queen of the Kalphites and most powerful of its species. Has two forms with different resistances and attacks with all three forms of combat.
  • For more information on fighting the Kalphite Queen, see Kalphite Queen/Strategies.

[[Kalphites]] can be assigned as a [[slayer task]] at level 15 [[combat]] by all [[Slayer Masters|slayer masters]], with the exception of Wilderness slayer master [[Krystilia]]. Kalphites come in a wide variety of levels, which is why they are possible tasks from all slayer masters. They are mainly found in the [[Kalphite Lair]] in the north-west of the [[Kharidian Desert]]. A Slayer task-exclusive area can be found in the [[Kalphite Cave]] just east of [[Shantay Pass]]. 

Kalphites comes in four varieties: [[Kalphite worker|workers]], [[Kalphite soldier|soldiers]] and [[Kalphite guardian|guardians]], as well as the boss monster the [[Kalphite Queen]]. With the exception of the Queen, all Kalphites use [[melee]] attacks. Additionally the '''soldiers and guardians can induce [[poison]]''' starting at 4 and 6 hitpoints damage respectively.

They are weak to [[melee]] attacks, especially [[crush]] attacks. Many are found in multi-combat areas, which mean players can attack multiple kalphites at once. The [[dwarf multicannon]] can also be set up in these areas to increase number of kills. ('''Note:''' The cannon '''will be destroyed''' by the Kalphite Queen, if set up in her arena.)
Because of their large size and use of melee attacks, they can easily be [[safespot]]ted throughout the cave networks.

=== Keris ===
[[Keris]] is a dagger awarded from completing the [[Contact!]] quest. It increases damage against all kalphites by 33% with a 1/51 chance of dealing a hit with tripled damage. However, in general, [[Keris]] is not recommended because of its low accuracy. Its stab attack is identical to that of a dragon dagger, with a Strength bonus of 10 lower. This makes the [[Dragon scimitar]] or [[Abyssal whip]] more ideal for fast damage.
